questions.description: Neutrophils and monocytes differ from each other in all of the following except :

options.description: The shape of their nuclei in mature form
Their contribution to total WBC content of blood
Their mode of action against foreign organisms

questions.description:
Complete the analogy w.r.t. normal count present in blood per mm³ :   
 Erythrocytes :  5.5 million  : : Thrombocytes :  ____.
Which among the following is not a formed element of blood ?
Which of the following is correct match w.r.t. component of blood and its normal amount in human blood ?
The most abundant agranulocyte present in human blood is :
Choose the correct sequence w.r.t. the number of formed elements in blood (in increasing order) :
The least and most abundant WBCs respectively are:
The granulocyte to arrive first at the site of an infection is :
Filter apparatus for dead R.B.C is :
The normal Albumin/ Globulin ratio is blood is :
Diapedesis means :

options.description: Process by which certain WBCs squeeze through thin capiliary wall

questions.description: Serum is :
Which WBC  has maximum lobs of nucleus ?

Which of the following WBCs are phagocytic cells?
(a) Monocytes  
(b) Neutrophils 
(c) Basophils  
(d) Eosinophils
Which of  the following is incorrect match of W.B.Cs with its functions ?

options.description: Eosinophils  - Resist infections and are also associated with allergic reactions
Basophils  - Secrete histamine, serotonin and heparin

questions.description: Which of the following factor is not related with delayed blood clotting ?

options.description: Presence of B antigen of RBC

questions.description: A Rh –ve mother gave birth to her first baby who is Rh +ve. To prevent hemolytic disease in her second foetus, she should be immediately administered with :
Lymph does not contain :

options.description: Large proteins and most of the formed elements

questions.description: Which of the following substances, if introduce in the blood stream, would cause coagulation, at the site of its introduction ?

If a person undergoes a road accident and during blood analysis it is found that both antibody A and B are present in blood. The blood of which of the following blood group is used for blood transfusion?
Erythroblastosis foetalis occurs in case of :

options.description: Rh⁺ mother and Rh¯ foetus during first pregnancy
Rh¯ mother and Rh⁺ foetus during first pregnancy
Rh⁺ mother and Rh¯ foetus during second pregnancy
Rh¯ mother and Rh⁺ foetus during second pregnancy

questions.description: If the plasma of a person contains 'B' antibodies and the RBCs have 'Rh' and 'A' antigens, the blood of the person should not be transfused to anyone with the blood group :
Lymph differs from blood in possessing :

options.description: More proteins and less waste products
Less proteins and more waste products
More proteins and more waste products
Less proteins and less waste products

questions.description:
Consider the following statements regarding double blood circulation :
 (A) Pulmonary circulation starts by the pumping of deoxygenated blood from right ventricle into lungs and its return in oxygenated form to right atrium. 
 (B) Systemic circulation starts with pumping of oxygenated blood from left ventricle through aorta to all body systems and return of the blood in deoxygenated form into left atrium through veins. 
 Select the correct answer from the given options :
Myogenic heart with incomplete double circulation is found in :
Which of the following cannot be taken as a feature of open type circulatory system ?

options.description: Well regulated blood supply to different organs
Blood returns to the heart slowly

questions.description: Mark the odd one w.r.t. the incomplete double circulation :
The opening present in the atrioventricular septum between left atrium and left ventricle is guarded by :
Maximum filling of blood in ventricles occurs during :

options.description: Period of iso–volumetric relaxation of only ventricles
Period of iso–volumetric contraction of only atria

questions.description: Which of the following is correct w.r.t. the second heart sound during a cardiac cycle ?

options.description: It is associated with the closure of semilunar valves at the beginning of ventricular systole
It is produced after an interval of 0.8 seconds from the first heart sound.
It is lower pitched and cannot be easily heard through a stethoscope
It is accociated with the closure of semilunar valves at the beginning of ventricular diastol

questions.description: Chordae tendineae in the heart are :

options.description: Connections between the pulmonary trunk and the aorta during embryonic stages
Thin fibres of the ventricular nodal tissue
Connections between the cuspid valves and the papillary muscles of ventricles

questions.description: Heart is protected by a double walled membranous bag called :
Which among the following is last to get depolarised in a cardiac cycle ?
The heart rate of healthy person is 72 times per minute. How much blood is pumped out by each ventricle during a cardiac cycle ?
The blood pressure of a person is measured as 130/75 mm Hg. His pulse pressure is :
The part of conducting system present in ventricular wall of human heart is :
Systemic heart refers to :

options.description: The heart that contracts under stimulation from nervous system
Left auricle and left ventricle in higher vertebrates
The two ventricles together in humans

questions.description: Which of the following layer of heart is related to difference in thickness of different chambers of heart ?
Which of the following are in direct contact with AV valves and prevent these from collapsing back into atria ?
The pacesetter in the heart is called :
Impulse of heart beat originates from :
Bundle of His is a network of :

options.description: Muscle fibres distributed throughout the heart  walls
Muscle fibres found only in the ventricle wall
Nerve fibres found throughout the heart

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : Left ventricle pumps blood at a much higher pressure to all body parts involved in systemic circulation. 
 Reason (R) : The muscular wall of the left ventricle is two to four times as thick as the wall of right ventricles.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description: Rate of heart beat is determined by :
At the end of joint diastole ventricle is :
An adult human with average health has systolic and diastolic pressures as :
High level of which ions change the strength of contraction :

Read the following statements w.r.t. the circulatory system : 
 (a) All vertebrates possess a muscular chambered heart
 (b) Heart is endodermally derived organ and is situated in thoracic cavity  
 (c)In human atria and ventricle of same side are separated by a thick fibrous tissue  
 (d) Heart is protected by a single walled membranous bag called pericardium 
 How many of the given statements is/are correct?
A patch of nodal tissue responsible for initiating the rhythmic contractile activity of heart is present in :

options.description: Lower left corner of the left ventricle
Upper right corner of the right atrium
Lower left corner of the right ventricle
Upper left corner of the left atrium

questions.description: Time interval between the closure of semilunar valve and closure of AV valve is :
If one litre of blood is drawn out of 5 litres from the body of man, how much blood would be left by the next day ?
A cardiac cycle involves :

options.description: Joint diastole – Ventricular systole – Auricular systole
Auricular systole  – Ventricular systole  –  Complete cardiac diastole
Auricular systole – Joint diastole – Ventricular systole
Auricular systole – Ventricular diastole – Joint diastole

questions.description: The opening of pulmonary vein is without valve because :

options.description: It is a very small aperture

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : Dub is a long and sharp sound. 
 Reason (R) : It is caused by closing of atrio ventricular valves.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description: The course of blood from the heart to the lungs and back to the heart is called :
Which of the following sequence is truly a systemic circulation pathway ?

options.description: Right ventricle →  Pulmonary aorta → Tissues → Pulmonary veins →  Left auricle
Right auricle →  Left ventricle →  Aorta → Tissues →  Veins → Right auricle
Left auricle →  Left ventricle →  Pulmonary aorta → Tissues →  Right auricle
Left ventricle →  Aorta → Arteries →  Tissues → Veins → Right auricle

questions.description:
During ventricular systole : 
 a. Blood gets filled in atria from vena cava  
 b.  Atrio–ventricular valves get opened  
 c. Semilunar valves get opened  
 d.  About 70 ml blood is pumped by each ventricle into large arteries normally
In human oxygenated blood flows from :

options.description: Left auricle to left ventricle during auricular systole
Right auricle to right ventricle during ventricular systole
Right ventricle to aorta during ventricular systole
Pulmonary vein to left auricle during auricular systole

questions.description:
Read the following statements (A–D) : 
 A. RBCs are the most abundant of all the cells in blood 
 B. A healthy adult man has on an average 5 billions to 5.5 billions of RBCs mm‾³ of blood 
 C. RBCs are formed in liver in the adults 
 D. RBCs are devoid of nucleus in mammals and are biconcave in shape 
 How many of the above statements are incorrect?
Pulmonary veins are those which :

options.description: Carry deoxygenated blood from lungs to heart
Carry oxygenated blood from lungs to heart
Carry deoxygenated blood from heart to lung
Carry oxygenated blood from heart to lungs

questions.description: During joint diastole :

options.description: Tricuspid and bicuspid valves are open
All the four chambers of heart are in a relaxed state

questions.description: Which information is incorrect about cardiac output?

options.description: The stroke volume multiplied by the heart rate, gives the cardiac output
It is the volume of blood pumped out by each ventricle per minute
The body has no  ability to alter the cardiac output

questions.description: The wall of arteries and veins are made up of these layers. Which of the following is the main difference in the structure of arteries and veins ?

options.description: Tunica media is made up of collagen fibres only in viens
Tunica externa is made up of endothelium in veins
Tunica intima is made up of smooth muslces in viens
Tunica media is comparatively thin in veins

questions.description: Which of the following function of sympathetic nervous system is not attributed towards vascular system in human body ?

options.description: Increase in the strength of ventricular contraction
Decrease in blood pressure through dilation of nearly all blood vessels

questions.description: To obtain a standard ECG , a patient is connected to the machine with three electrodes attached :

options.description: One to each wrist and to the left ankle
One to each ankle and to the left wrist
One to each wrist and to the left chest region
One to each ankle and to the left chest region

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : Portal system consists of a vein which starts from capillaries and end into capillaries. 
 Reason (R) : All vertebrates have hepatic portal system.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description: In what way pulmonary artery is different from pulmonary vein ?
In veins, valves are present to check backward flow of blood flowing at :
Fastest distribution of some injectible material/medicine with no risk of any kind can be achieved by injecting it into the :
Rate of heart beat and cardiac output can be increased by :

options.description: Neural signal through the sympathetic nerves

questions.description: Choose the incorrect match :
A portal system is one in which :

options.description: A vein starts from an organ and ends up in heart
A vein starts from an organ and ends up in another organ
A vein starts from heart and ends up in lungs

questions.description: Indicate correct statement for human :

options.description: Arteries always carry oxygenated blood while veins always carry deoxygenated blood
Venous blood is returned to left auricle
Arteries are provided with valves while veins are devoid to valves
Arteries always carry blood away from the heart, while veins always carry blood towards the heart

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : The resting heart rate, about 75/minutes, usually is lower than the autorhythmic rate of the SA node (90–100 beats/minute). 
 Reason (R) : At resting conditions, the parasympathetic effects dominate.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description: Choose the incorrect statement w.r.t. artherosclerosis:

options.description: Calcium salts precipitate with the cholesterol  forming plaque
The artery becomes loose and elastic
The lumen of artery becomes narrower

questions.description: Angina pectoris :

options.description: Occurs due to conditions that effect the blood flow
Involves acute chest pain when not enough oxygen is reaching heart muscles

questions.description: Which of the following cells does not exhibit phagocytic activity ?
One of the common symptoms observed in people infected with Dengue fever is :
Which among the followings is correct during each cardiac cycle?

options.description: The volume of blood pumped out by the Rt and Lt ventricles is same
The volume of blood pumped out by the Rt and Lt ventricles is different
The volume of blood received by each atrium is different
The volume of blood received by the aorta and pulmonary artery is different

questions.description: Cardiac activity could be moderated by the autonomous neural system. Tick the correct answer :

options.description: The parasympathetic system stimulates heart rate and stroke volume
The sympathetic system stimulates heart rate and stroke volume
The parasympathetic system decreases the heart rate but increases stroke volume
The sympathetic system decreases the heart rate but increases stroke volume

questions.description: Mark the pair of substances among the following which is essential for coagulation of blood :
ECG depicts the depolarisation and repolarisation processes during the cardiac cycle. In the ECG of a normal healthy individual one of the following waves is not represented :
Which one of the following types of cells lack nucleus in humans ?
Which one of the following blood cells is involved in antibody production ?
The cells involved in inflammatory reactions are :
The second heart sound (dub) is associated with the closure of :
Which of the following correctly explains a phase/ event in cardiac cycle in a standard electrocardiogram?

options.description: Time between S and T represents atrial systole
P-wave indicates beginning of ventricular contraction

questions.description: Which of the following statements is incorrect ?

options.description: A person of ‘O’ blood group has anti ‘A’ and anti ‘B’ antibodies in his blood plasma
A person of ‘B’ blood group can’t donate blood to a person of ‘A’ blood group
Blood group is designated on the basis of the presence of antibodies in the blood plasma
A person of AB blood group is universal recipient

questions.description: What would be the cardiac output of a person having 72 heart beats per minute and a stroke volume of 50 ml?

Read the following statements and choose the correct option :
 Statement A :  Atria receive blood from all parts of the body which subsequently flows to ventricles.
 Statement B : Action potential generated at sinoatrial node passes from atria to ventricles.

options.description: Statement A is correct but statement B is incorrect
Statement B is correct but statement A is incorrect
Both statements A and B are correct
Both statements A and B are incorrect

questions.description:
Match the terms given under column-I with their functions given under column-II and select the answer from the options given below :
Column-I 
A. Lymphatic system
B. Pulmonary vein 
C. Thrombocytes 
D. Lymphocytes
Column-II
i. Carries oxygenated blood
ii. Immune response
iii.To drain back the tissue fluid to the circulatory  
iv. Coagulation of blood
G–6–P dehydrogenase deficiency is accociated with haemolysis of :
If  RBCs are placed in distilled water, the corpuscles will :
If spleen of human is removed from body then :

options.description: Number of blood platelets will increase
Number of blood platelets will decrease
There will be no effect on the number of blood platelets

questions.description: All of the following factors increase cardiac output  of an individual, except :
Which of the following blood vessels bypass are present in the circulatory system before birth ?
Systolic pressure is higher than diastolic pressure due to :

options.description: Volume of blood in the heart is greater during systole
Blood vessels offer resistance to flowing blood during systole
Blood is forced into arteries during systole.

questions.description: The number of QRS complexes observed per minute in an ECG of a person was 85. What could be the heart rate of that person during observation ?
The strength of ventricular contraction increases when SAN is stimulated by :
By the end of joint diastole, the ventricles are almost _________ filled.
